page.title: 04CRUDWELL VILLAGE GREEN
page.content: {Crudwell village green}is very attractive.In spring there are snowdrops and daffodils.The rooks are busy building their nests.During the summer the trees make it a cool place to have a picnic.In the Autumn the leaves turn yellow and look really colourful.The green is triangular, near the school and church and enclosed by roads.Parking is not allowed.Around the edges of the green are{18 tall trees}(17{lime}and 1 beech) and 9 young lime trees.These were planted in 1984 and have wire fencing around them.Two stone bridges cross the{brook}which runs across the green parallel with the main road.Many interesting{water plants and animals are found here.Also on the green are a {metal bench}which has been there since the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II and a{stone milestone.
